1.verse: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.

2.verse: Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;

3.verse: Though the waters thereof roar and be troubled, though the mountains shake with the swelling thereof. Selah.

4.verse: There is a river, the streams whereof shall make glad the city of God, the holy place of the tabernacles of the most High.

5.verse: God is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: God shall help her, and that right early.

6.verse: The heathen raged, the kingdoms were moved: he uttered his voice, the earth melted.

7.verse: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.

8.verse: Come, behold the works of the LORD, what desolations he hath made in the earth.

9.verse: He maketh wars to cease unto the end of the earth; he breaketh the bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in the fire.

10.verse: Be still, and know that I am God: I will be exalted among the heathen, I will be exalted in the earth.

11.verse: The LORD of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge. Selah.
